Software Documentation¶

Configuration of Project Environment¶

Developing a Developer tool/GUI for performing spectral analysis.

Overview on How to Run this project¶

  1. Either install a Python IDE or create a Python virtual environment to install the packages required

  2. Install packages required

Setup procedure¶

  1. Create a Python Virtual Environment

    • Install virtualenv:

      pip install virtualenv

    • Create virtialenv:

      virtualenv -p python3 <name of virtualenv>
or
conda create -n yourenvname python=x.x anaconda

    • Activate virtualenv:

      source <name of virtualenv>/bin/activate

    • Install requirements:

      pip install -r requirements.txt
  2. Install Sphinx and Rinotype

    • Install via cmd:

      pip install Sphinx
pip install rinohtype

    • Setup Sphinx:

      sphinx-quickstart
    • Open source/conf.py::

      Configure path to root directory. The path should point to the root directory of the project and looking at the project structure, from conf.py we should reach the root by going up two parent directories

    • Create the final document

      make html/confluence

CODE DOCUMENTATION¶

1. LOAD DATA¶

interpolate¶

interpolate.cubicInterpolationSpectra(x, y, start, stop, totalPointsDesired)[source]¶
CubicInterpolationSpectra

Interpolate original data with cubic spline

Parameters

  • x (array) – original data array.

  • y (array) – original data array

  • start (int) – desired range start position

  • stop (int) – desired range stop position

  • totalPointsDesired (int) – the total number of points which defines the point spacing

Returns

newX, New point spacing and newY, New interpolated data

2. PREPROCESSING¶

featureSelection¶

featureSelection.RFFeatureSelection(XTrain, yTrain, XTest, yTest, wavelengths)[source]¶
RFFeatureSelection

Random Forest feature selection, Plot the wavelengths vs Feature Importance for target based on RF on spectral data

Parameters

  • xTrain (ndarray) – Train spectral data

  • yTrain (ndarray) – Train target data

  • xTest (ndarray) – Test spectral data

  • yTest (ndarray) – Test target data

  • wavelengths (list) – List denoting wavenumber or wavelength.

Returns

Graph of wavelengths vs Feature Importance for target based on RF on spectral data

featureSelection.impRange(m, n, XTrain, XTest, wavelengths)[source]¶
ImpRange

Perpares important spectral data based on important wavelength range from the graph generated form RFFeatureSelection function.

Parameters

  • m (int) – Lower limit of important wavelength range

  • n (int) – Upper limit of important wavelength range

  • XTrain (ndarray) – Train spectral data

  • XTest (ndarray) – Test spectral data

  • wavelengths (list) – List denoting wavenumber or wavelength.

Returns

Important train and test spectral data based on RF feature selection
